item.description:
Made in 1920 in Germany, The Golem is considered a "Frankenstein" story, one that predates Mary Shelley's version.

Suffering under the tyrannical rule of Rudolf II in 16th Century Prague, a rabbi creates a warrier to protect the safety of his people. Sculpted of clay and animated by the secrets of the kabala the golem seems to be indestructable; performing great feats of heroism, yet cabable of dreadful violence. Live music acompanyist by cellist Cyrstal Pascucci.

Admission is only $3.00

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Silent Film/Live Music The Golem
